installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# steamcmd Base Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server
# Image to install with is 'ghcr.io/parkervcp/installers:debian'

##
#
# Variables
# STEAM_USER, STEAM_PASS, STEAM_AUTH - Steam user setup. If a user has 2fa enabled it will most likely fail due to timeout. Leave blank for anon install.
# WINDOWS_INSTALL - if it's a windows server you want to install set to 1
# SRCDS_APPID - steam app id found here - https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dedicated_Servers_List
# SRCDS_BETAID - beta branch of a steam app. Leave blank to install normal branch
# SRCDS_BETAPASS - password for a beta branch should one be required during private or closed testing phases.. Leave blank for no password.
# INSTALL_FLAGS - Any additional SteamCMD  flags to pass during install.. Keep in mind that steamcmd auto update process in the docker image might overwrite or ignore these when it performs update on server boot.
# AUTO_UPDATE - Adding this variable to the egg allows disabling or enabling automated updates on boot. Boolean value. 0 to disable and 1 to enable.
#
 ##

# Install packages. Default packages below are not required if using our existing install image thus speeding up the install process.
apt -y update
apt -y --no-install-recommends install curl lib32gcc-s1 ca-certificates

## just in case someone removed the defaults.
if [[ "${STEAM_USER}" == "" ]] || [[ "${STEAM_PASS}" == "" ]]; then
    echo -e "steam user is not set.\n"
    echo -e "Using anonymous user.\n"
    STEAM_USER=anonymous
    STEAM_PASS=""
    STEAM_AUTH=""
else
    echo -e "user set to ${STEAM_USER}"
fi

## download and install steamcmd
cd /tmp
mkdir -p /mnt/server/steamcmd
curl -sSL -o steamcmd.tar.gz https://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/client/installer/steamcmd_linux.tar.gz
tar -xzvf steamcmd.tar.gz -C /mnt/server/steamcmd
mkdir -p /mnt/server/steamapps # Fix steamcmd disk write error when this folder is missing
cd /mnt/server/steamcmd

# SteamCMD fails otherwise for some reason, even running as root.
# This is changed at the end of the install process anyways.
chown -R root:root /mnt
export HOME=/mnt/server

## install game using steamcmd
./steamcmd.sh +force_install_dir /mnt/server +login ${STEAM_USER} ${STEAM_PASS} ${STEAM_AUTH} $( [[ "${WINDOWS_INSTALL}" == "1" ]] && printf %s '+@sSteamCmdForcePlatformType windows' ) +app_update ${SRCDS_APPID} $( [[ -z ${SRCDS_BETAID} ]] || printf %s "-beta ${SRCDS_BETAID}" ) $( [[ -z ${SRCDS_BETAPASS} ]] || printf %s "-betapassword ${SRCDS_BETAPASS}" ) ${INSTALL_FLAGS} validate +quit ## other flags may be needed depending on install. looking at you cs 1.6

## set up 32 bit libraries
mkdir -p /mnt/server/.steam/sdk32
cp -v linux32/steamclient.so ../.steam/sdk32/steamclient.so

## set up 64 bit libraries
mkdir -p /mnt/server/.steam/sdk64
cp -v linux64/steamclient.so ../.steam/sdk64/steamclient.so

variables.name: Server Name
variables.description: Name that appears in server browser.

variables.name: Server Password
variables.description: Server password.

variables.name: World Name
variables.description: Name to load if switching between multiple saved worlds.

variables.name: Public Server
variables.description: Public visibility of your server. Set it to false to make the server invisible and only joinable via the 'Join IP'-button.

variables.name: App ID
variables.description: Valheim steam app id for auto updates.

variables.name: LD Library Path
variables.description: Required to load server libraries.

variables.name: Shutdown Command
variables.description: Commands to trigger a server shutdown.

variables.name: Auto Update
variables.description: Enable automatic updates.

variables.name: Enable Crossplay
variables.description: Enable crossplay support.

variables.name: Backup Interval
variables.description: Change how often the world will save in seconds. Default: 1800 (30 minutes).

variables.name: Backup Count
variables.description: Sets how many automatic backups will be kept. The first is the 'short' backup length, and the rest are the 'long' backup length. When default values are used means one backup that is 2 hours old, and 3 backups that are 12 hours apart. Default: 4.

variables.name: Backup Shorttime
variables.description: Sets the interval between the first automatic backups in seconds. Default: 7200 (2 hours).

variables.name: Backup Longtime
variables.description: Sets the interval between the subsequent automatic backups in seconds. Default: 43200 (12 hours).

variables.name: Beta Branch
variables.description: Beta branch of a steam app. Leave blank to install normal branch.

variables.name: Beta Password
variables.description: Password for a beta branch should one be required during private or closed testing phases. Leave blank for no password.

variables.name: Console Filter
variables.description: Remove unwanted outputs from the console.

variables.name: Combat
variables.description: Combat multiplier. Can be veryeasy, easy, normal, hard or veryhard.

variables.name: Resources
variables.description: Resource multiplier. Can be muchless (0.5x), less (0.75x), normal, more (1.5x), muchmore (2x) or most (3x).

variables.name: Death Penalty
variables.description: Death Penalty modifier. Casual (keep equipped, 1% skill loss), veryeasy (all items dropped, 1% loss), easy (all drop, 2.5% loss), normal (all drop, 5% loss), hard (equipment dropped, unequipped items destroyed, 7.5% loss), hardcore (all inventory items and skills are destroyed).

variables.name: Raid Rate
variables.description: Raid rate frequency.

variables.name: Portals
variables.description: Portal behavior. Casual (all items). Normal (no ingots/ores). Hard (portals deactivate during boss fights). Veryhard (no portals at all).
